intro: Hieracium albatipes, commonly known as the albatross hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow to orange flower heads that are composed of many small florets. Hieracium albatipes is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
